9/10

Amazing game that is still great 15 years after its original release, with an immersive storyline. Similar to the original Half Life game, i love that Half Life 2 never directly tells you anything, and let you explore the world around you. It has a variety of different experiences from chapter to chapter, with everything from driving on a boat along a river of toxic waste to picking up enemies and flinging them around in the citadel.

The only 3 problems I had with this game were:

1. The AI of the combine was lacking in comparison to the marines from the original game. In the original 1998 game, the marines would actually be in groups, flank, have a sense of self preservation etc. In Half Life 2, the combine pretty much just run at you and die.

2, The original Half Life, in my opinion, had a larger arsenal of weapons with a wider variety of different types of weapons. The 1998 game had the hivehand, the snarks, the gluon gun, the tau cannon, etc. In Half Life 2, there's the gravity gun and that's about all as far as unique weapons go.

3. This is only a small problem, but i found my self frustrated both at the end of the Sandtraps chapter and in the Anticitizen One chapter. The antlions in the former would always get in my way, and in one playthrough one jumped up in front of me, causing me to fall as i was jumping across a ledge to my death. The citizens that follow you and """""help""""" you in latter are constantly standing in the way, especially in the indoor sections.


Overall, Half Life 2 is an amazing game that definitely is worth purchasing, and it makes you feel immersed in the beautifully written storyline.

I've played this game through at least three times over the years. There's pretty much nothing I can say about this game that hasn't already been said: it was groundbreaking for the time, and still holds up pretty darn well today. Some levels can get somewhat tedious (the airboat section I feel was roughly 5-10 mins too long) but it's so inventive in its level design that you won't hold a grudge over the occasional misstep. It is an improvement over the first game in every conceivable way. If the price is reasonable (and it usually is) scoop up this beacon of gaming history and experience it for yourself.

Half-Life 2 just like it's predecessor Half-Life is a game that has an amazing story, game play and quality (at the time) that i'm sure made millions satisfied. Yes there are bad things about Half-Life 2 but the all the great things about it immediately cancel all the bad out. I think that I and many others can agree that Half-Life 2 is a brilliant work of art and will never be forgotten no matter if we don't get our long waited Half-Life 3.

This game is honestly a must play for anybody. The reason why many of the reviews you've been scrolling through are so short is because this game holds a legendary status that is well deserved. The enriching story, the innovation the game offered, the incredibly fun physics engine...

No matter how idiotic the gaming industry gets or how stale and boring it may become, we'll always have the classics for those old and young. Half Life 2 is a reminder of that.

Well, I guess this game is amazing when you play it for the first time. Especially when you play it around the time it's released. But, the more you play this game, you will realized that this game has some flaw to it. The combat is just too easy and not enganging. The cutscene spend way too much time and you can't skip it. But overall, this game is great visually considering it was made in 2005 and the soundtrack is good. And I also like the story. This game is one of my favorite, so I give this game an 8/10
